name.japanese: 魚人島への海底ルート

description: The underwater route from Sabaody Archipelago to Fish-Man Island, 10,000 meters beneath the sea. Ships must be coated with special resin bubbles from Sabaody to survive the journey through these dangerous depths.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Begin Underwater Journey
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates begin their descent through the underwater route to Fish-Man Island aboard the bubble-coated Thousand Sunny.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the beginning of a dangerous journey into the depths and represents entering truly unknown territory for the crew.

keyEvents.title: Caribou Pirates Attack
keyEvents.description: The Caribou Pirates attack the Thousand Sunny while traveling through the underwater route.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the dangers present even on the journey to Fish-Man Island.

statusHistory.reason: Route is actively being traveled during this episode

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' second ship, built by Franky and powered by cola. In this episode, it travels underwater with bubble coating toward Fish-Man Island.

keyEvents.title: Kuma's Protection Revealed
keyEvents.description: Franky reveals that Bartholomew Kuma protected the Thousand Sunny for two years while the crew was separated, fighting off Marine attacks.
keyEvents.significance: Explains how the ship survived the two-year timeskip and reveals Kuma's incredible sacrifice.

keyEvents.title: Hatchan and Duval's Protection
keyEvents.description: It's revealed that Hatchan and Duval sustained heavy injuries protecting the Sunny from Marines before Kuma arrived.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the loyalty of the Straw Hats' allies during the timeskip.

keyEvents.title: Begins Underwater Journey
keyEvents.description: The Thousand Sunny, coated with resin bubbles, begins its descent to Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the ship's first major underwater journey in the New World saga.

statusHistory.reason: Ship is operational and traveling underwater

description: An archipelago of trees that forms the final island before the New World. The Straw Hats departed from here to begin their underwater journey.

keyEvents.title: Rayleigh Reflects on Straw Hats' Departure
keyEvents.description: Rayleigh and Shakky talk at the coast where the Straw Hats departed, with Rayleigh reminiscing about Roger.
keyEvents.significance: Provides a reflective moment connecting the old and new generation of pirates.

keyEvents.title: Location of Kuma's Protection
keyEvents.description: Revealed as the location where Kuma protected the Thousand Sunny for two years against Marine attacks.
keyEvents.significance: Site of Kuma's sacrifice and the allies' protection of the ship.

statusHistory.reason: Location remains active in flashbacks and references
